title.narrative: 4.5 NUTRITION IN HUMANITARIAN SITUATIONS

description.narrative: Output 4.5: By 2018, governmental institutions and civil society organizations at national, regional, district and local levels have strengthened capacities to coordinate and implement an effective nutrition response in emergency situations, which contributes to Nutrition And Emergencies, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 4: Children under 5, pregnant and lactating women, particularly among the most vulnerable, have access to and make greater use of quality promotional, preventive and curative services for the prevention of chronic malnutrition, management of acute malnutrition and reduction of micronutrient deficiencies.

description.narrative: Through UNICEF&39;s technical assistance, nutrition cluster/sector coordination was strengthened both at national level and in Diffa region. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/01/2019
